sen.e: When Yorimasa and Nakatsuna died in the battle of Rising of Prince Mochihito, he was in Izu Province with Nakatsuna's second son, MINAMOTO no Aritsuna, and they joined the army to search and kill the Heishi (Taira clan).

sen.j: 頼朝は同じ清和源氏の一門には冷たく当たる傾向があったが、その一方でこの広綱や足利義兼（源義兼）、平賀義信（源義信）などは厚遇し、あえて格差をつけるようなことも行った。
sen.e: Yoritomo treated well such persons as Hirotsuna, Yoshikane ASHIKAGA (MINAMOTO no Yoshikane), and Yoshinobu HIRAGA (MINAMOTO no Yoshinobu), while he often treated the other family members of the same Seiwa-Genji clan (Minamoto clan) rather coldly, by sometimes giving them different treatments on purpose.

sen.j: 翌年6月、神護寺の文覚が広綱が遁世して上醍醐にあることを鎌倉に報じた。
sen.e: In July 1191, Mongaku, Buddhist monk at Jingo-ji Temple informed to Kamakura that Hirotsuna was living a retired life in seclusion at Kami Daigo.

sen.j: 逐電の理由は、頼朝の右大将拝賀の際に供奉人に選ばれなかったこと、駿河国の国務について希望がかなえられなかったことだという。
sen.e: The reasons of his disappearance was said to be that he was not chosen as gobunin (a selected attendant for a special service) at the occasion of Yoritomo's Udaisho-haiga, a courtesy visit to the Imperial Court to receive the appointment to Udaisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and that his policy in Suruga Province was not accepted as he desired.
